news_list.headline: Jharkhand Man Spots Village Home On Video Call, Reunites With Family After 13 Years
news_list.description: Deepak Dehri was separated from his family at the tender age of five, and spent the next 13 years at a children's home some 1,700 km away from his village in Jharkhand's Dumka.

news_list.headline: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana: Rs 12 To Be Deducted From Bank Account Before May 31
news_list.description: Under it, due to accidental death, the nominee gets Rs two lakh, while in case of partial disability an amount Rs one lakh is given.

news_list.headline: CGBSE Class 12 Exams: Chhattisgarh Board To Hold Exams From June 1; Details Here
news_list.description: CGBSE 12th Exams: While the students will be required to take the exams in offline mode, they can appear for the Class 12 board exams from home.

news_list.headline: Past Results Shouldn't Matter Much Ahead Of India's WC 2022, Asia Cup Qualifiers: Gurpreet Singh Sandhu
news_list.description: Indian football goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu feels the team shouldn't think too much about the results of friendlies against Oman and UAE in March and focus on the upcoming WC 2022 and Asia Cup qualifiers in Doha.

news_list.headline: India's Crude Imports Stall In April As Virus Stifles Demand
news_list.description: India's top state oil refiners reduced processing runs and crude imports in April as the pandemic took a toll on fuel consumption, leading to higher product stockpiles at the plants.

news_list.headline: 2 Indore Sisters Detained For Online Contacts With Suspected ISI Agents
news_list.description: Two sisters from Indore's Mhow town have been detained over suspected espionage over their contacts with Pakistani men suspected to be ISI agents.

news_list.headline: 21.80 Crore Covid Vaccine Doses Provided To States, Union Territories So Far: Centre
news_list.description: More than 21.80 crore vaccine doses against COVID-19 have been provided to states and Union Territories so far and over 1.90 crore jabs are still available with them, the Union Health Ministry said on Sunday.

news_list.headline: Chris Gayle Photographed With David Warner's "Type Of Car"
news_list.description: David Warner took a liking to the car Chris Gayle posed with, in the latter's latest Instagram post.

news_list.headline: Lockdown In Rajasthan Extended Due To Covid Surge Till June 8
news_list.description: The Rajasthan government has extended the coronavirus lockdown by 15 days till June 8. The state may allow some relaxations in commercial activities from June 1 in districts where the COVID-19 situation will improve significantly.

news_list.headline: Centre Solely Responsible For Bodies In Ganga, Says Rahul Gandhi
news_list.description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said the Centre is solely responsible for bodies flowing in the Ganga and it is not a collective responsibility.

news_list.headline: Police Case Filed Against Kamal Nath Over Remarks On B.1.617 Variant
news_list.description: A police case has been registered against former Madhya Pradesh chief minister and Congress chief Minister Kamal Nath for his remarks that tagged the B.1.617 Covid variant as the "Indian Variant".

news_list.headline: Badrinath Temple Priests Slam Uttarakhand Minister's Visit Amid Lockdown
news_list.description: Temple priests at Uttarakhand's Badrinath have objected to the visit of the minister in-charge of COVID-19 response Dhan Singh Rawat and other BJP leaders to the shrine, calling it a breach of the lockdown norms, news agency ANI has reported.

news_list.headline: "Few Reports" Of Heart Issue In US After Covid Vaccine, No Clear Link Yet
news_list.description: US health authorities said they were looking into a small number of reports of heart inflammation among some younger people who received Covid vaccines, with no clear link established for the moment.

news_list.headline: India "Late To The Table" In Buying Vaccines: Top Virologist
news_list.description: India delayed the process of bulk-buying vaccines unlike several other nations and may now have few options available in the international market. "Aren't we a little late to the table on this one?'' said top virologist Dr Gagandeep Kang.

news_list.headline: Arrested Wrestler Sushil Kumar Had Murder Filmed To Spread Fear: Cops
news_list.description: Olympic medallist Sushil Kumar, arrested in a murder case, had a video of the incident recorded to terrorise the wrestling circuit in the city, the police said on Sunday, as it received six days' custody of the wrestler at a Delhi court.

news_list.headline: Mumbai Student Designs "Cool PPE Kit" With Ventilation For Covid Warriors
news_list.description: With an aim to provide some relief to healthcare workers on the frontlines of the COVID-19 battle, a 19-year-old Mumbai student has developed a compact ventilation system for PPE kits.

news_list.headline: "Sedition": Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister On Kamal Nath's Covid Remarks
news_list.description: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said state Congress chief Kamal Nath's alleged remarks on the spread of coronavirus in India could amount to sedition.

news_list.headline: Bengal Governor Played "Instrumental Role" In Narada Case Order: Trinamool
news_list.description: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar said he was left flabbergasted today as Trinamool MP Kalyan Banerjee launched a tirade against him, claiming that it was at his behest the three leaders and a former city mayor were arrested in the Narada case.

news_list.headline: Former Atomic Energy Commission Chief Srikumar Banerjee Dies, PM Modi Pays Condolences
news_list.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday condoled the demise of former chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission Dr Srikumar Banerjee.

news_list.headline: India Becomes 3rd Nation After US, Brazil To Cross 3 Lakh Covid Deaths
news_list.description: India becomes third nation after US, Brazil to cross 3 lakh COVID-19 deaths

news_list.headline: 70 Deaths In Sunken Barge Tragedy, Navy Searching For 16 Missing
news_list.description: The death count on barge P305 which sank during Cyclone Tauktae fury rose to 70 on Sunday with the recovery of four more bodies, the Navy said, adding it is continuing the search for 16 more believed missing from the barge and tugboat Varaprada.

news_list.headline: No Covaxin Doses Left For 45-Plus, Health Workers After Monday: Delhi MLA
news_list.description: There will be no Covaxin doses left for those aged above 45, frontline and healthcare workers in Delhi after Monday, with no clarity on the supply of the next installment from the Centre, AAP MLA Atishi said on Sunday.

news_list.headline: Chhattisgarh Cops Serve Notice On BJP's Sambit Patra Over 'Toolkit' Post
news_list.description: Raipur police in Chhattisgarh asked BJP's Sambit Patra to appear before it in person or through video-conferencing at 4pm on Sunday in connection with an FIR lodged against him over an alleged fake toolkit, officials said.

news_list.headline: Man Slapped By Chhattisgarh IAS Officer To Get New Phone: Chief Minister
news_list.description: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday directed that a new mobile phone as a compensation will be provided to the youth, whose mobile got damaged during the alleged misbehaviour by the collector.

news_list.headline: Goa Board's Class 12 Exam Cancelled, Class 12 Decision In Two Days
news_list.description: The Goa government has cancelled Class X exams in the state in view of the COVID-19 outbreak and a decision on Class XII exams would be taken in the next two days, Chief Minister Pramod Sawant said on Sunday.

news_list.headline: 12 Opposition Parties Support Farmer Group Protest Call On May 26

news_list.description: Haryana will launch on Monday an anti-Covid "Sanjeevani Pariyojana" to provide for supervised and quick medical care at home largely for people in rural areas with mild to moderate symptoms of the disease.

news_list.headline: India Challenges $1.2 Billion Arbitration Award To UK's Cairn Energy
news_list.description: India has challenged an international arbitration tribunal asking it to return $1.2 billion to UK's Cairn Energy Plc on grounds that it had never agreed to arbitrate over a "national tax dispute", the finance ministry said.

news_list.headline: "Clarification Not Enough": Health Minister To Ramdev Over Allopathy Row
news_list.description: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan tells Ramdev to withdraw "objectionable remarks" against doctors

news_list.headline: Researchers Find 2 New Multi Drug-Resistant Bacteria In Scat Of "Vine Snake"
news_list.description: A group of researchers from Pune and Chandigarh has discovered two new "multi drug-resistant" bacteria from the scat of "vine snake", a mildly venomous reptile, commonly found in Northern Western Ghats.

news_list.headline: Prepare For Worst-Case Scenario: Disaster Response Force On Cyclone Yaas
news_list.description: Cyclone Yaas: As West Bengal and Odisha brace for another severe cyclone after the Amphan havoc last year, National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) chief SN Pradhan asked authorities in the two states to adopt an over-preparing approach.

news_list.description: Two senior BJP leaders, summoned in connection with the recent highway robbery of hawala money at Kodakara in Kerala's Thrissur ahead of the April 6 Assembly polls, did not turn up for the interrogation on Sunday, police said.

news_list.description: Absence of medical resources forced COVID-19 patients to fend for themselves and look for oxygen concentrator as an alternative to liquid medical oxygen (LMO) and even procure the device from overseas amid short supply, the Delhi High Court has said.

news_list.headline: Priyanka Gandhi Seeks Rs 1 Crore Aid For Families Of Teachers Who Died In UP
news_list.description: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra demanded that the government give Rs 1 crore compensation each to the family of teachers who have died and employment to one dependent.

news_list.description: Security has been stepped up in Haryana's Hisar district as farmers have planned to picket the residence of a senior police officer tomorrow to protest criminal cases filed against more than 300 farmers.

news_list.description: Punjab has said that the US pharma major Moderna had refused to directly supply its Covid vaccine to the state as it only deals with the central government.

news_list.description: Mayurbhanj, Bhadrak and Balasore districts are likely to be worst affected by the cyclonic storm Yaas which will reach the state on May 26, Umashankar Das, Deputy Director of India Meteorological Department (IMD) in Bhubaneswar on Sunday said.

news_list.description: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel, in a string of tweets on Sunday, said he has ordered the immediate removal of Surajgarh District Collector for slapping a person who was out to buy medicines amid the Covid-19 lockdown.

news_list.description: Reach out to people, sensitise them, make sure they are evacuated in time and minimise the power outages, Prime Minister Narendra Modi told various agencies and officials on Sunday after a review meet to assess preparedness over Cyclone Yaas

news_list.description: Wrestler Sushil Kumar, India's two-time Olympic medallist, wasarrested this morning over alleged involvement in the murder of a fellow wrestler in Delhi. He had been evading arrest for nearly 20 days, Delhi police said.

news_list.description: With 2,40,842 new Covid cases, India's overall case count surged to 2,65,30,132 this morning. The country's total Covid death count is nearing the 3 lakh-mark; 3,741 deaths were reported in the last 24 hours.

news_list.description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Saturday accused the opposition of practising duplicity over the anti-Covid vaccination, saying those opposing the vaccines earlier are now rushing to get them free of cost.

news_list.description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said those indulging in black-marketing of Remdesivir injections in the state are being charged under the stringent National Security Act (NSA).

news_list.description: Barge P305 which sank during Cyclone Tauktae fury six days ago was located on the seabed on Saturday, the Navy said, while it continued the search for 20 missing personnel from two vessels.

news_list.description: The government of West Bengal today reported first case of death due to mucormycosis, commonly known as Black Fungus infection,

news_list.headline: BJP Targets Kamal Nath For

news_list.description: A man who was going to buy medicines was slapped by a district official and thrashed by policemen amid the COVID-19 lockdown in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur. Visuals of the incident were shared widely on social media.

news_list.description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday hit out at Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the government's handling of the novel coronavirus pandemic amid India's fight against Covid.

news_list.description: Maharashtra on Saturday reported 26,133 fresh COVID-19 cases and 682 deaths, taking the tally to 55,53,225 and the death count to 87,300, the state health department said.

news_list.headline: Assam To Bring Cow Protection Bill In Next Assembly Session: Governor
news_list.description: The Assam government plans to bring in a law to protect cows by banning transport of cattle outside the state, among other measures.

news_list.headline: 15-Year-Old Boy Affected By Black Fungus After Covid Recovery In Gujarat
news_list.description: A 15-year-old-boy in Ahmedabad in Gujarat has been detected with Mucormycosis or Black Fungus a week after he recovered from COVID-19, a doctor treating him said today.

news_list.description: The Delhi High Court on Saturday observed that unpreparedness of the health infrastructure in the national capital had compelled many desperate citizens of Delhi to seek admission and medical attention at hospitals in the neighboring states.

news_list.headline: Coronavirus Curfew Extended Till May 31 In UP
news_list.description: The partial coronavirus curfew in Uttar Pradesh has been extended till 7 am on May 31, a state government statement said on Saturday.

news_list.headline: Ramdev Draws Doctors' Fury, Legal Trouble Over "Allopathy Is Stupid" Video
news_list.description: Yoga guru Ramdev, the face of one of India's biggest consumer goods and alternative medicine empires, has been asked to apologise by the Indian Medical Association for ostensibly saying more people died of modern medical treatments during Covid.

news_list.headline: Family Of Delhi Doctor Who Died Of Covid Given Rs 1 Crore
news_list.description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday provided financial assistance of Rs one crore to the family of late "Corona warrior" Dr Anas Mujahid.

news_list.description: Coronavirus vaccination centres run by Mumbai's civic body will be shut today, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) announced on Saturday adding that the details for Monday will be shared by them on Twitter on Sunday.

news_list.description: The WHO is yet to reach a consensus on the vaccine passport issue for allowing international travel to those fully vaccinated against the coronavirus infection, the government said on Saturday and noted that discussions are still on.

news_list.description: Two doses from either the Oxford/AstraZeneca or the Pfizer vaccine are over 80 per cent effective in preventing infection from the B1.617.2 variant of COVID-19, first discovered in India, a new UK government study has reportedly found.

news_list.description: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan today said that the coronavirus-induced restrictions in the state would be gradually relaxed from the next month.

news_list.headline: Door-To-Door Vaccination In Villages Along Line Of Control In J&K

news_list.description: The Centre is now focused on ensuring that children do not become part of the chain spreading COVID-19, NITI Ayog member - Health, Dr VK Paul said today.

news_list.description: Twenty-six Jharkhand migrant workers stuck in Nepal due to COVID-induced lockdown there on Saturday reached India-Nepal border and boarded a bus for their home in Dumka, a top official said.

news_list.headline: BJP Leader Seeks Culpable Homicide Case Against Company In Barge Tragedy
news_list.description: Maharashtra BJP leader Ashish Shelar on Saturday demanded that Afcons Infrastructure whose chartered barge P305 sank off the Mumbai coast on May 17, leaving 60 onboard personnel dead so far, be charged with culpable homicide.

news_list.headline: Lioness, Blackbucks Drowned In Gujarat, But Not Due To Cyclone Tauktae, Says Official: Report
news_list.description: A lioness and four blackbucks were found dead near a dam at Visavadar in Gir forest division of Gujarat's Junagadh district, an official said today.

news_list.headline: 2 Arrested For Duping Woman Of Over Rs 5 Lakh On Matrimonial Site: Delhi Police
news_list.description: Two men have been arrested for allegedly duping women after promising to marry them, the police said today.

news_list.headline: "US Stands With People Of India" In Fight Against Covid: Envoy
news_list.description: The United States stands with the people of Delhi and India in the fight against COVID-19, said US envoy Daniel B Smith today.

news_list.headline: "Can't Live Without
news_list.description: Former TMC MLA Sonali Guha, who switched over to the BJP ahead of the elections, on Saturday wrote to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, apologising to her for leaving the party and urging her to take her back.

news_list.headline: Delhi Reports 3.5% Covid Positivity, Lowest Cases Since March 31
news_list.description: Delhi's positivity rate has dropped to 3.58 per cent, lowest since April 1, as the more contagious and dangerous wave of the coronavirus infections continued to recede.

news_list.headline: "Prove It!": Navjot Sidhu Furious As Amarinder Singh Hints He May Join AAP
news_list.description: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who has been critical of Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh over the desecration issue, today challenged him to prove that he had met any leader of other party for switching sides.

news_list.headline: Salman Rushdie's Tweet After Being Mistaken For Salman Khurshid
news_list.description: It all started with senior Congress leader Salman Khurshid describing former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi and his son Rahul Gandhi as the "once" and "future king" of democracy.

news_list.headline: Over 8 Lakh Migrants Left Delhi In 4 Weeks Of Lockdown Amid 2nd Covid Wave: Report
news_list.description: Over eight lakh migrant workers left the national capital in the first four weeks of the lockdown imposed to contain the spread of the second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to a report from the Delhi Transport Department.

news_list.headline: Tamil Nadu Extends Lockdown For A Week, Announces Stricter Curbs
news_list.description: Shops will remain open today and tomorrow till 9 pm to help public stock up on things.

news_list.headline: Cyclone Yaas May Intensify Into "Very Severe Cyclonic Storm", Cross Odisha, Bengal: Report
news_list.description: A low-pressure area formed over east-central Bay of Bengal, which is likely to intensify into a very severe cyclonic storm and move towards Bengal, adjoining north Odisha and Bangladesh coasts around May 26 morning, the regional met department said.

news_list.headline: Jharkhand Slams Centre For Objection To Supreme Court Intervention On Covid
news_list.description: The Jharkhand government hailed the Supreme Court for its timely intervention, saying it led to optimal distribution and utilisation of oxygen and other essential drugs amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

news_list.headline: Over 8,800 Affected By Black Fungus, 23,000 Vials Sent To States: Minister
news_list.description: Nearly 9,000 people have been infected with mucormycosis or Black Fungus across the country, Union Minister Sadananda Gowda said today. In view of the rapid surge, the government has sent over 20,000 vials of a key drug used for its treatment.

news_list.headline: Arvind Kejriwal Has 4 Suggestions For PM Modi To Increase Vaccination
news_list.description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal today gave four suggestions to the central government to increase the vaccine supply.

news_list.headline: "Take Immediate Action": Sonia Gandhi To PM On Black Fungus Drug Shortage
news_list.description: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi in a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi cited the acute shortage of vital drug - Amphotericin-B - needed to treat Black Fungus, and underscored the need to "take immediate action" to remedy the situation.

news_list.headline: Over 1.6 Crore COVID-19 Vaccine Doses Still Available With States: Centre
news_list.description: More than 1.6 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with states and union territories, and over 2.67 lakh doses will be supplied to them in the next three day, the Union health ministry said today.

news_list.headline: "In A Helicopter For A Photo Session": Uddhav Thackeray's Jibe At PM Modi Over Cyclone Tauktae
news_list.description: Amid BJP's criticism over the duration of his visit to cyclone-hit Konkan region of Maharashtra, Uddhav Thackeray hit back, saying that he was at least taking stock of the situation on the ground and not conducting an aerial survey in a helicopter.

news_list.headline: Bengal BJP Leader Suvendu Adhikari's Father, Brother Get Y+ Security
news_list.description: The Centre today further fueled the politics of confrontation in West Bengal, extending security cover to father and brother of Suvendu Adhikari, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's arch rival.

news_list.headline: 420 Doctors, Including 100 In Delhi, Died In 2nd Covid Wave: Medical Body
news_list.description: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) has said 420 doctors, including 100 in Delhi, have succumbed to the coronavirus infection in the crippling second wave of the pandemic that has overwhelmed the hospitals and has kept the crematoriums blazing.

news_list.headline: Oxygen Express Piloted By All Women Crew Brings 120 Tonne Oxygen To Bengaluru
news_list.description: An Oxygen Express train piloted by an "All Female Crew" arrived in Bengaluru with 120 metric tonnes of medical oxygen from Jamshedpur, the Railways said today.

news_list.headline: "Why Is Uttarakhand Getting Step-Child" Treatment" Amid Covid: High Court To Centre
news_list.description: The Uttarakhand High Court has rapped the Centre for not paying heed to the medical needs of people in remote areas of the state amid the raging second wave of COVID-19, saying it is treating the hill state like a "step-child".

news_list.headline: Uttarakhand Government Issues SOPs To Prevent Black Marketing Of Black Fungus Medicine
news_list.description: The Uttarakhand government has issued Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to prevent the black marketing of Black Fungus medicine keeping in view cases of the disease being reported across the country.

news_list.headline: Goa Government Pegs Losses Due To Cyclone Tauktae At Rs 146 Crore
news_list.description: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Friday said the state suffered losses to the tune of Rs 146 crore due to cyclone Tauktae.

news_list.headline: ONGC Employee Released A Month After Kidnapping In Assam
news_list.description: Assam insurgent group United Liberation Front of Asom - Independent (ULFA-I) today released Ritul Saikia, an ONGC employee it had kidnapped last month.

news_list.headline: COVID-19 Crisis In India A Warning For Other Middle-Income Nations: IMF
news_list.description: Observing that the ongoing "catastrophic" 2nd wave of COVID-19 in India is a sign that the worst may be yet to come, the IMF said the situation in India is a warning of the possible events in low-and middle-income nations.

news_list.headline: CBI Gives Clean Chit To Lalu Yadav In DLF Bribery Case: Sources
news_list.description: The CBI has given a clean chit in a bribery case to former railway minister and Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Lalu Yadav, who is out on bail since April after spending more than three years in jail, sources have said.

news_list.headline: Delivered 13,319 Tonnes Of Liquid Medical Oxygen To States So Far: Railways
news_list.description: The Railways has so far delivered 13,319 tonnes of liquid medical oxygen (LMO) in more than 814 tankers to states across the country since it started operating the Oxygen Express service last month.

news_list.headline: 2.57 Lakh New Covid Cases In India, Highest Testing In A Day: 10 Points
news_list.description: India recorded 2.57 lakh fresh Covid cases and 4,194 deaths in the last 24 hours. The country saw a new record with 20,66,285 samples tested since yesterday. The overall case count surged past the 2.62 crore-mark this morning.

news_list.headline: India, Pfizer Seek To Bridge Dispute Over Vaccine Indemnity: Report
news_list.description: Pfizer and the Indian government are seeking to resolve tensions over a demand by the US drugmaker for legal protection from any claims linked to the use of its COVID-19 vaccine in one of the world's biggest markets, two sources told Reuters.

news_list.headline: Coronavirus India Updates: 2.57 Lakh New Covid Cases In India; Over 8,800 Affected By Black Fungus, Says Minister
news_list.description: India on Saturday recorded new cases of coronavirus infection at over 2.57 lakh, taking the total tally of COVID-19 cases to 2,62 crore according to the Union Health Ministry data.

news_list.headline: Delhi Goverment Think-Tank Gets Over 2,300 Oxygen Concentrators Through Donations
news_list.description: The Dialogue and Development Commission got donations for over 2,300 oxygen concentrators.

news_list.headline: Supreme Court To Hear Plea To Prevent Alleged Exodus Of People Due To Bengal Violence
news_list.description: Supreme Court agreed to hear a plea seeking directions to the Centre and West Bengal government to prevent alleged exodus of people due to "state-sponsored" violence and forming an SIT to investigate and take appropriate action against culprits.

news_list.headline: Chargesheet Against Actor Deep Sidhu, Others In Republic Day Violence Case
news_list.description: Nearly four months after the violence at Red Fort on the Republic Day, Delhi Police has filed a voluminous chargesheet against actor-activist Deep Sidhu and 15 others in connection with the case.

news_list.headline: Remove "Indian Variant" References, Centre To Social Media Firms: Report
news_list.description: The information technology (IT) ministry has written to all social media companies asking them to take down any content that refers to an "Indian variant" of the coronavirus, according to a letter issued on Friday which was seen by Reuters.

news_list.headline: Army Chief Reviews Situation Along Northern Border In Arunachal Pradesh
news_list.description: Army Chief Gen MM Naravane reviewed India's operational readiness along the boundary with China in the Arunachal Pradesh sector during a two-day visit to the Northeastern region that began on Thursday.

news_list.headline: Navy Decommissions INS Rajput After 41 Years Of Service
news_list.description: The Indian Navy's Kashin-class destroyer INS Rajput, the first warship to be fitted with long-range BrahMos missile, was decommissioned on Friday after 41 years of service.

news_list.headline: After NDTV Report, Assam LPG Delivery Staff Designated Frontline Workers
news_list.description: Two days after NDTV carried a report of LPG distributors asking the Assam government to vaccinate cooking gas delivery staff by recognising them as frontline workers, the state government has said it will soon start inoculating them.

news_list.headline: Tripura Reports Its First Case Of Black Fungus Infection In Covid Patient
news_list.description: Tripura reported its first case of Mucormycosis or Black Fungus in a COVID-19 patient, two days after the infection was declared an epidemic by the centre.

news_list.headline: "Lack Of Medical Facility": P Chidambaram On Declining Cases, Rising Deaths
news_list.description: The daily Covid-19 death figure remains above 4,000 despite a declining case positivity, indicating a lack of medical care, Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram said Friday, inviting a prompt reply from Health Minister Harsh Vardhan

news_list.headline: 188 Rescued, 60 Bodies Recovered After Barge Sinks Off Mumbai Coast
news_list.description: At least 188, including two from the anchor boat Varaprada, have been rescued so far from the barge P305, which sank after Cyclone Tauktae hit the Arabian Sea off the coast of Mumbai on May 17, the Defence Public Relations Officer (PRO) said Friday.

news_list.headline: Covid Hospital Discharges Outnumber Admissions For 1st Time In Nearly 2 Months
news_list.description: For the first time in nearly two months, the number of people discharged from hospitals on a daily basis after recovering from COVID has outnumbered the number of those getting admitted, official data shows.

news_list.description: The National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) has begun positioning its teams in West Bengal and Odisha as Cyclone Yaas is likely to hit these states on the eastern coast of the country around May 26-27, officials said on Friday.

news_list.headline: Uttar Pradesh To Declare Black Fungus Notifiable Disease
news_list.description: The Uttar Pradesh government will declare black fungus a notifiable disease under the Epidemic Diseases Act.

news_list.headline: 45 Lakh Affected In Massive Air India Data Breach Including Credit Cards
news_list.description: Ten years' worth of customer data including credit cards, passports and phone numbers has been leaked in a massive breach at Air India, the airline has announced.

news_list.headline: After Narada Order That Divided Judges, Larger High Court Bench Announced
news_list.description: A larger bench of the Calcutta High Court will take up the case involving the arrests in the Narada bribery case on Monday after all four Bengal politicians - including two ministers - were sent to house arrest after two judges of the division bench

news_list.headline: 'There's No 5G Testing, Towers Don't Spread Covid': States Battle Rumour
news_list.description: A rumour that 5G testing in India has led to a spike in Covid cases and deaths has fueled fears in villages of Haryana, Punjab, and UP. The government is battle the paranoia.

news_list.headline: Arvind Kejriwal, US envoy Discuss Ways To Address Pandemic
news_list.description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and US envoy Daniel B Smith on Friday discussed the ways in which Delhi and America can work together to address the COVID pandemic.

news_list.headline: Chhattisgarh Sends Rs 1,500 Crore To 22 Lakh Farmers For Monsoon Sowing
news_list.description: The Chhattisgarh government has spent Rs 1,500 crore in paying 22 lakh farmers directly into their bank accounts as input cost subsidy so that they can prepare to sow kharif or monsoon crop.

news_list.headline: Over 300 Black Fungus Cases In Pune, Short On Treatment Drug: Ajit Pawar
news_list.description: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar on Friday said over 300 cases of Mucormycosis, a fungal infection prevalent among people who have recovered from COVID-19, have been reported in Pune district.

news_list.headline: Israel President Praises "Generosity, Kind-Heartedness" of Indian Caregiver Killed In Hamas Rocket Attack
news_list.description: Israeli President Reuven Rivlin has praised the "generosity and kind-heartedness" of an Indian caregiver who was killed on May 11 in a rocket attack by Palestinian terrorists from Gaza.

news_list.headline: 13 Maoists Including 7 Women Killed In Maharashtra's Gadchiroli Encounter
news_list.description: Thirteen Maoists including seven women were killed in an encounter with police in the Etapalli forest area in Gadchiroli district of Maharashtra on Friday.

news_list.headline: "Would Rather Die": Jailed Activist Stan Swamy On Mumbai Hospital Treatment
news_list.description: Jesuit priest Stan Swamy told the Bombay High Court on Friday that his health has deteriorated steadily since his arrest, but he would rather "suffer and possibly die" than getting treatment at a state-run hospital in Mumbai.

news_list.headline: Watch: Heavy Rain In Odisha As East Coast Braces For Cyclone Yaas
news_list.description: Several parts of Odisha received heavy rain today even as the state government laid down guidelines for coastal districts in view of the forecast on the formation of cyclonic storm Yaas.

news_list.headline: Karnataka Extends Lockdown Till June 7, Daily Cases Above 32,000
news_list.description: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa on Friday further extended the statewide lockdown till June 7 to fight the surge in Covid cases.

news_list.headline: "Resume Farm Law Talks": Farmers' Body Tells PM Modi
news_list.description: Several rounds of talks between farmers and the government representatives have failed to break the deadlock over the three Central pieces of legislation.

news_list.headline: "Unconstitutional": Court On IGST On Imported Oxygen Concentrators For Personal Use
news_list.description: The Delhi High Court Friday held as "unconstitutional", the imposition of Integrated Goods and Services Tax (IGST) by the Centre on import of oxygen concentrators by individuals for personal use.

news_list.headline: Minister Meets Family Of Kerala Woman Killed In Hamas Strike
news_list.description: Union Minister V Muraleedharan on Friday visited the residence of Soumya Santhosh, who was killed in a Palestinian rocket attack in Israel, and assured the Centre's support to the needs of her nine-year-old son.

news_list.headline: 5.8 Magnitude Earthquake Near Changlang In Arunachal Pradesh
news_list.description: An earthquake of magnitude 5.8 was reported near Changlang in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday evening, according to India's National Center for Seismology.

news_list.headline: Focused On "Fake Praises": Akhilesh Yadav Targets PM Modi, Yogi Adityanath
news_list.description: Attacking Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav said lives of people could have been saved had both focused on arranging essentials for Covid patients instead of indulg

news_list.headline: 120-Year-Old Kashmir Woman Takes Covid Jab; Honoured By Army Commander
news_list.description: A 120-year-old woman has become an inspiration for people living in rural areas of Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district after she took a lead in her remote hamlet to get vaccinated against COVID-19.

news_list.headline: High Courts Must Avoid Passing Impossible Covid Orders: Supreme Court
news_list.description: The Supreme Court on Friday asked the various High Courts to avoid passing orders impossible to implement when it comes to Covid-related matters.

news_list.headline: Uddhav Thackeray Making Political Remarks Over Cyclone: Devendra Fadnavis
news_list.description: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray was making "political comments" while touring areas of the state hit by cyclone Tauktae and advised the latter that "this is not the time to indulge in politics"

news_list.headline: Rs 35-75 Lakh Compensation For Families Of Those Killed In Barge Tragedy
news_list.description: Afcons Infrastructure, whose chartered barge P305 with 261 personnel at the Bombay High offshore oilfield was wrecked by Cyclone Tauktae earlier this week, on Friday announced compensation to families who lost their loved ones in the incident.

news_list.headline: "Ensure Medical Supplies Stocks": Centre To States Bracing For Cyclone Yaas
news_list.description: The Centre has asked Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal and Andaman and Nicobar Islands to ensure that health facilities are stocked with essential medicines and supplies to meet any exigencies in the wake of Cyclone Yaas.

news_list.headline: In Madhya Pradesh, 4 Die Of Black Fungus, Injection Shortage Reported
news_list.description: Four people from Damoh and Balaghat districts in Madhya Pradesh have died of Mucormycosis even as the state grapples with a shortage of injections for its treatment, officials said.

news_list.headline: What Is Black Fungus And Why Are Cases Up In India: What We Know So Far
news_list.description: Several thousand coronavirus patients in India have contracted a deadly and aggressive fungal infection, compounding the country's troubles as it reels from the pandemic.

news_list.headline: India Vaccine Export Ban Hurts Developing Nations, Says IMF
news_list.description: Unveiling a proposal on how a $50 billion investment plan can vaccinate people around the world against COVID-19 by the middle of next year, the IMF on Friday said India's decision to ban the export of vaccines was affecting developing countries.

news_list.headline: $9 Trillion Benefit, Normalcy Sooner: IMF Plan To Vaccinate All By Mid-2022
news_list.description: About $50 billion may be all it takes to vaccinate all eligible people around the world by the middle of next year, the International Monetary Fund or IMF has said, proposing an investment programme.

news_list.headline: Strengthen Facilities For Children Orphaned By COVID-19: Centre To States
news_list.description: The Union home ministry has asked states and union territories to strengthen facilities for vulnerable groups, especially children, who have been orphaned in the second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic in order to check human trafficking, a government s

news_list.headline: Have To Reserve Beds For PM, President, Says Court On Plea For Transparency
news_list.description: The Delhi High Court Friday said beds have to reserved in hospitals for treatment of certain categories of people like the President and Prime Minister of the country.

news_list.headline: Tarun Tejpal Acquittal May Deter Other Assault Victims, Say Activists
news_list.description: Women rights activists have said the decision to acquit journalist Tarun Tejpal in a sexual assault case will deter other victims from coming forward to report crimes against them, saying once again a survivor was "demeaned and humiliated".

news_list.headline: Centre Asks Twitter To Drop "Manipulated" Tag For Toolkit Tweets: Sources
news_list.description: The government has asked Twitter to remove "manipulated media" tag for tweets on an alleged "Congress toolkit" to discredit COVID-19 efforts, calling it "prejudicial, a clear overreach and unwarranted", sources said today.

news_list.headline: Will Seek Centre's Aid For Infra To Reduce Cyclone Impact: Uddhav Thackeray
news_list.description: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said his government will seek Central assistance to set up permanent infrastructure along the sea coast to minimize the damage caused by cyclones.

news_list.headline: US Defended Amazon After Article Showed It Bypassed Indian Law: Report
news_list.description: US officials rushed to defend Amazon's business practices in India after reports that the company had favored certain sellers on its website and bypassed local law.

news_list.headline: MK Stalin Seeks Release Of Rajiv Gandhi Case Convicts; No, Says Congress
news_list.description: The Tamil Nadu Congress Committee on Friday said it does not agree with Chief Minister MK Stalin demanding the centre to set free the seven Rajiv Gandhi assassination case life convicts and denounced what it called ''political pressure".

news_list.headline: Rebel Andhra MP Gets Bail, Supreme Court Says May Have Been Ill-Treated
news_list.description: Rebel YSR Congress MP K Raghurama Krishnam Raju, arrested on sedition charges last week, was granted bail by the Supreme Court today. The court observed that he may have been ill-treated in police custody.

news_list.headline: A Temple For 'Corona Devi' In Tamil Nadu
news_list.description: A 'Corona Devi' temple has come up on the outskirts of Coimbatore in Tamil Nadu. An idol, named 'Corona Devi' made of black stone has also been placed in the temple.

news_list.headline: DRDO Develops Antibody Test Kit DIPCOVAN For Early Covid Detection
news_list.description: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has developed an antibody test kit for the early screening of COVID-19.

news_list.headline: Centre Explores Possibility Of Covaxin Production Outside India: Report
news_list.description: To address the shortage of COVID-19 jabs in the country, the government is exploring the possibility of boosting production of vaccines, including identifying manufacturing sites for indigenously developed Covaxin outside India, sources said.

news_list.headline: Shashi Tharoor's Reply After KTR Suspects His Role In Naming Covid Drugs
news_list.description: Most social media platforms are swarming with names of drugs used to treat COVID-19 infection as India continues to battle the second wave of the pandemic.

news_list.headline: Southwest Monsoon Arrives Over Andaman And Nicobar Islands: Met Office
news_list.description: Monsoon 2021: The Southwest Monsoon has arrived over the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, the India Meteorological Department said on Friday.

news_list.headline: Goa Government To Move High Court Against Tarun Tejpal's Acquittal: Chief Minister
news_list.description: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Friday said the state government will challenge in the high court journalist Tarun Tejpal's acquittal in a 2013 rape case by a district court in state capital Panaji.

news_list.headline: "Matter Of Great Concern": Sachin Pilot On Rajasthan MLA's Resignation
news_list.description: Congress leader and former deputy chief minister Sachin Pilot on Friday said senior legislator Hemaram Chaudhary's resignation is a matter of concern.

news_list.headline: 5 More Manufactures Given License To Produce Black Fungus Treatment Drug: Government
news_list.description: The Union Health Ministry on Friday said license has been given to five more manufactures for production of Amphotericin-B, used in the treatment of black fungus, and they will start producing 1,11,000 vials of the drug per month from July.

news_list.headline: Centre To Ramp Up Production, Availability Of Anti-Black Fungus Medicine
news_list.description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Friday said the Central government will make proactive efforts for significantly ramping up domestic production of Amphotericin-B drug, an anti-fungal drug for the treatment of Black Fungus disease.

news_list.headline: India, Pfizer At Impasse Over Vaccine Indemnity Demand: Report
news_list.description: Pfizer and New Delhi are at loggerheads over a demand by the US drugmaker for legal protection from any claims linked to the use of its COVID-19 vaccine in one of the world's biggest markets, two sources told Reuters.

news_list.headline: "Centre Involved In Anti-People Activities, Exploiting Farmers": Sonia Gandhi
news_list.description: Congress president Sonia Gandhi on Friday accused the BJP-led government at the Centre of indulging in anti-people activities, playing with the future of farmers and acting against their interests by bringing new agriculture laws.

news_list.headline: Doorstep Treatment Will Reduce Burden On Health System: PM Modi
news_list.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that bringing treatment to the doorsteps of patients will reduce the burden on the health system and he also provided a new mantra in COVID management - 'Jaha bimar, wahi upchaar'.

news_list.headline: Covid Patients Ran Out After Oxygen Leak Chaos At Bengal Hospital: Report
news_list.description: Oxygen leakage at the North Bengal Medical College and Hospital in Siliguri was a cause of concern among COVID-19 patients and their families this morning, officials said.

news_list.headline: Delhi's Covid Positivity Rate Falls Below 5%, Lowest Since April 4
news_list.description: Coronavirus: Delhi's COVID-19 positivity rate has fallen below 5 per cent in the past 24 hours, which is the lowest since April 4.

news_list.headline: UK Cases Of India-Dominant Variant More Than Double In Week
news_list.description: The number of U.K. cases of a worrying India-dominant coronavirus variant more than doubled for a second week as authorities also monitor a new mutation of the virus, adding fresh doubt to U.K. plans to fully unlock the economy.

news_list.headline: International Tea Day 2021: 10 Interesting Things To Know About Tea
news_list.description: International Tea Day 2021: All over the world, International Tea Day is being celebrated today. Did you know tea is the second most popular drink after water? Find out few interesting facts about tea

news_list.headline: Video: Gang Waves Gun At Birthday 'Party', Mocks Madhya Pradesh Lockdown
news_list.description: A gang of young men in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district turned a birthday party into a show of strength, waving guns and mocking the coronavirus lockdown.q

news_list.headline: Mamata Banerjee Set To Contest From Earlier Seat After Losing Nandigram
news_list.description: Mamata Banerjee, who swept the Bengal election but lost her own contest in Nandigram, is set to return to the seat she gave up in favour of challenging her former aide Suvendu Adhikari in his stronghold.

news_list.headline: "Insult To Assam People": Activist Akhil Gogoi 'Manhandled' Before Oath
news_list.description: Jailed RTI activist Akhil Gogoi, who was elected from Assam's Sibsagar seat in the recently held state polls, was allegedly manhandled at the Assembly by government personnel before he was sworn in as an MLA today.

news_list.headline: Tarun Tejpal, Acquitted Of Rape, Recounts "7.5 Years Of Trauma For Family"
news_list.description: Journalist Tarun Tejpal, who was acquitted of rape charges in a 2013 case by court in Goa today, said the last seven-and-a-half years had been traumatic for his family as they dealt with the catastrophic fallout of the false allegations against him.

news_list.headline: Foreign Minister S Jaishankar To Begin 5-Day US Visit From Monday: Centre
news_list.description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will begin a five-day visit to the United States from Monday with a focus on procurement of COVID-19 vaccines from American companies as well as explore the possibility of their joint production.

news_list.headline: Sunderlal Bahuguna, Noted Environmentalist, Dies Of COVID-19
news_list.description: Sunderlal Bahuguna, one of India's best-known environmentalist and a pioneer of the Chipko Movement against the cutting of trees, today died of COVID-19 in Rishikesh.

news_list.headline: Cyclone Tauktae: 51 Dead, 24 Missing From Sunken Barge P305, Navy Continues Search
news_list.description: The number of deaths on barge P305 that sank in the Arabian Sea five days ago rose to 51 on Friday with the recovery of two more bodies even as the Navy and the Coast Guard continued the search for the 24 personnel missing from the barge

news_list.headline: PM Chokes Up As He Pays Tribute: "This Virus Took Away Many Loved Ones"
news_list.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was visibly emotional today as he spoke about those who had lost their lives to Covid.

news_list.headline: On Rajiv Gandhi's Death Anniversay, Congress Leader Tweets Throwback Pics
news_list.description: Today marks the 30th death anniversary of former prime minister Rajiv Gandhi and social media tributes have been pouring in from all quarters for the leader.

news_list.headline: BJP's Sambit Patra's 'Toolkit' Post Marked "Manipulated Media" By Twitter
news_list.description: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra's tweet alleging a "Congress toolkit" to discredit the government and Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Covid handling has been marked as "manipulated media" by Twitter.

news_list.headline: Anti Terrorism Day 2021: Homage To Heroes Who Died Fighting Terrorists
news_list.description: Anti Terrorism Day 2021: India observes Anti Terrorism Day to spread the message of peace and humanity. Anti Terrorism Day is marked on the death anniversary of Rajiv Gandhi

news_list.headline: "Black Fungus A New Challenge, We Must Be Prepared," Says PM
news_list.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today warned against what he called the "new challenge of Black Fungus" and said the country must be prepared to fight the rare and potentially fatal condition that is increasingly seen in recovering Covid patients.

news_list.headline: Jharkhand Man Spots Village Home On Video Call, Reunites With Family After 13 Years
news_list.description: Deepak Dehri was separated from his family at the tender age of five, and spent the next 13 years at a children's home some 1,700 km away from his village in Jharkhand's Dumka.

news_list.headline: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana: Rs 12 To Be Deducted From Bank Account Before May 31
news_list.description: Under it, due to accidental death, the nominee gets Rs two lakh, while in case of partial disability an amount Rs one lakh is given.

news_list.headline: CGBSE Class 12 Exams: Chhattisgarh Board To Hold Exams From June 1; Details Here
news_list.description: CGBSE 12th Exams: While the students will be required to take the exams in offline mode, they can appear for the Class 12 board exams from home.

news_list.headline: Past Results Shouldn't Matter Much Ahead Of India's WC 2022, Asia Cup Qualifiers: Gurpreet Singh Sandhu
news_list.description: Indian football goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu feels the team shouldn't think too much about the results of friendlies against Oman and UAE in March and focus on the upcoming WC 2022 and Asia Cup qualifiers in Doha.

news_list.headline: India's Crude Imports Stall In April As Virus Stifles Demand
news_list.description: India's top state oil refiners reduced processing runs and crude imports in April as the pandemic took a toll on fuel consumption, leading to higher product stockpiles at the plants.

news_list.headline: 2 Indore Sisters Detained For Online Contacts With Suspected ISI Agents
news_list.description: Two sisters from Indore's Mhow town have been detained over suspected espionage over their contacts with Pakistani men suspected to be ISI agents.

news_list.headline: 21.80 Crore Covid Vaccine Doses Provided To States, Union Territories So Far: Centre
news_list.description: More than 21.80 crore vaccine doses against COVID-19 have been provided to states and Union Territories so far and over 1.90 crore jabs are still available with them, the Union Health Ministry said on Sunday.

news_list.headline: Chris Gayle Photographed With David Warner's "Type Of Car"
news_list.description: David Warner took a liking to the car Chris Gayle posed with, in the latter's latest Instagram post.

news_list.headline: Lockdown In Rajasthan Extended Due To Covid Surge Till June 8
news_list.description: The Rajasthan government has extended the coronavirus lockdown by 15 days till June 8. The state may allow some relaxations in commercial activities from June 1 in districts where the COVID-19 situation will improve significantly.

news_list.headline: Centre Solely Responsible For Bodies In Ganga, Says Rahul Gandhi
news_list.description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said the Centre is solely responsible for bodies flowing in the Ganga and it is not a collective responsibility.

news_list.headline: Police Case Filed Against Kamal Nath Over Remarks On B.1.617 Variant
news_list.description: A police case has been registered against former Madhya Pradesh chief minister and Congress chief Minister Kamal Nath for his remarks that tagged the B.1.617 Covid variant as the "Indian Variant".

news_list.headline: Badrinath Temple Priests Slam Uttarakhand Minister's Visit Amid Lockdown
news_list.description: Temple priests at Uttarakhand's Badrinath have objected to the visit of the minister in-charge of COVID-19 response Dhan Singh Rawat and other BJP leaders to the shrine, calling it a breach of the lockdown norms, news agency ANI has reported.

news_list.headline: "Few Reports" Of Heart Issue In US After Covid Vaccine, No Clear Link Yet
news_list.description: US health authorities said they were looking into a small number of reports of heart inflammation among some younger people who received Covid vaccines, with no clear link established for the moment.

news_list.headline: India "Late To The Table" In Buying Vaccines: Top Virologist
news_list.description: India delayed the process of bulk-buying vaccines unlike several other nations and may now have few options available in the international market. "Aren't we a little late to the table on this one?'' said top virologist Dr Gagandeep Kang.

news_list.headline: Arrested Wrestler Sushil Kumar Had Murder Filmed To Spread Fear: Cops
news_list.description: Olympic medallist Sushil Kumar, arrested in a murder case, had a video of the incident recorded to terrorise the wrestling circuit in the city, the police said on Sunday, as it received six days' custody of the wrestler at a Delhi court.

news_list.headline: Mumbai Student Designs "Cool PPE Kit" With Ventilation For Covid Warriors
news_list.description: With an aim to provide some relief to healthcare workers on the frontlines of the COVID-19 battle, a 19-year-old Mumbai student has developed a compact ventilation system for PPE kits.

news_list.headline: "Sedition": Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister On Kamal Nath's Covid Remarks
news_list.description: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said state Congress chief Kamal Nath's alleged remarks on the spread of coronavirus in India could amount to sedition.

news_list.headline: Bengal Governor Played "Instrumental Role" In Narada Case Order: Trinamool
news_list.description: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar said he was left flabbergasted today as Trinamool MP Kalyan Banerjee launched a tirade against him, claiming that it was at his behest the three leaders and a former city mayor were arrested in the Narada case.

news_list.headline: Former Atomic Energy Commission Chief Srikumar Banerjee Dies, PM Modi Pays Condolences
news_list.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday condoled the demise of former chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission Dr Srikumar Banerjee.

news_list.headline: India Becomes 3rd Nation After US, Brazil To Cross 3 Lakh Covid Deaths
news_list.description: India becomes third nation after US, Brazil to cross 3 lakh COVID-19 deaths

news_list.headline: 70 Deaths In Sunken Barge Tragedy, Navy Searching For 16 Missing
news_list.description: The death count on barge P305 which sank during Cyclone Tauktae fury rose to 70 on Sunday with the recovery of four more bodies, the Navy said, adding it is continuing the search for 16 more believed missing from the barge and tugboat Varaprada.

news_list.headline: No Covaxin Doses Left For 45-Plus, Health Workers After Monday: Delhi MLA
news_list.description: There will be no Covaxin doses left for those aged above 45, frontline and healthcare workers in Delhi after Monday, with no clarity on the supply of the next installment from the Centre, AAP MLA Atishi said on Sunday.

news_list.headline: Chhattisgarh Cops Serve Notice On BJP's Sambit Patra Over 'Toolkit' Post
news_list.description: Raipur police in Chhattisgarh asked BJP's Sambit Patra to appear before it in person or through video-conferencing at 4pm on Sunday in connection with an FIR lodged against him over an alleged fake toolkit, officials said.

news_list.headline: Man Slapped By Chhattisgarh IAS Officer To Get New Phone: Chief Minister
news_list.description: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday directed that a new mobile phone as a compensation will be provided to the youth, whose mobile got damaged during the alleged misbehaviour by the collector.

news_list.headline: Goa Board's Class 12 Exam Cancelled, Class 12 Decision In Two Days
news_list.description: The Goa government has cancelled Class X exams in the state in view of the COVID-19 outbreak and a decision on Class XII exams would be taken in the next two days, Chief Minister Pramod Sawant said on Sunday.

news_list.headline: 12 Opposition Parties Support Farmer Group Protest Call On May 26

news_list.description: Haryana will launch on Monday an anti-Covid "Sanjeevani Pariyojana" to provide for supervised and quick medical care at home largely for people in rural areas with mild to moderate symptoms of the disease.

news_list.headline: India Challenges $1.2 Billion Arbitration Award To UK's Cairn Energy
news_list.description: India has challenged an international arbitration tribunal asking it to return $1.2 billion to UK's Cairn Energy Plc on grounds that it had never agreed to arbitrate over a "national tax dispute", the finance ministry said.

news_list.headline: "Clarification Not Enough": Health Minister To Ramdev Over Allopathy Row
news_list.description: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan tells Ramdev to withdraw "objectionable remarks" against doctors

news_list.headline: Researchers Find 2 New Multi Drug-Resistant Bacteria In Scat Of "Vine Snake"
news_list.description: A group of researchers from Pune and Chandigarh has discovered two new "multi drug-resistant" bacteria from the scat of "vine snake", a mildly venomous reptile, commonly found in Northern Western Ghats.

news_list.headline: Prepare For Worst-Case Scenario: Disaster Response Force On Cyclone Yaas
news_list.description: Cyclone Yaas: As West Bengal and Odisha brace for another severe cyclone after the Amphan havoc last year, National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) chief SN Pradhan asked authorities in the two states to adopt an over-preparing approach.

news_list.description: Two senior BJP leaders, summoned in connection with the recent highway robbery of hawala money at Kodakara in Kerala's Thrissur ahead of the April 6 Assembly polls, did not turn up for the interrogation on Sunday, police said.

news_list.description: Absence of medical resources forced COVID-19 patients to fend for themselves and look for oxygen concentrator as an alternative to liquid medical oxygen (LMO) and even procure the device from overseas amid short supply, the Delhi High Court has said.

news_list.headline: Priyanka Gandhi Seeks Rs 1 Crore Aid For Families Of Teachers Who Died In UP
news_list.description: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra demanded that the government give Rs 1 crore compensation each to the family of teachers who have died and employment to one dependent.

news_list.description: Security has been stepped up in Haryana's Hisar district as farmers have planned to picket the residence of a senior police officer tomorrow to protest criminal cases filed against more than 300 farmers.

news_list.description: Punjab has said that the US pharma major Moderna had refused to directly supply its Covid vaccine to the state as it only deals with the central government.

news_list.description: Mayurbhanj, Bhadrak and Balasore districts are likely to be worst affected by the cyclonic storm Yaas which will reach the state on May 26, Umashankar Das, Deputy Director of India Meteorological Department (IMD) in Bhubaneswar on Sunday said.

news_list.description: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel, in a string of tweets on Sunday, said he has ordered the immediate removal of Surajgarh District Collector for slapping a person who was out to buy medicines amid the Covid-19 lockdown.

news_list.description: Reach out to people, sensitise them, make sure they are evacuated in time and minimise the power outages, Prime Minister Narendra Modi told various agencies and officials on Sunday after a review meet to assess preparedness over Cyclone Yaas

news_list.description: Wrestler Sushil Kumar, India's two-time Olympic medallist, wasarrested this morning over alleged involvement in the murder of a fellow wrestler in Delhi. He had been evading arrest for nearly 20 days, Delhi police said.

news_list.description: With 2,40,842 new Covid cases, India's overall case count surged to 2,65,30,132 this morning. The country's total Covid death count is nearing the 3 lakh-mark; 3,741 deaths were reported in the last 24 hours.

news_list.description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Saturday accused the opposition of practising duplicity over the anti-Covid vaccination, saying those opposing the vaccines earlier are now rushing to get them free of cost.

news_list.description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said those indulging in black-marketing of Remdesivir injections in the state are being charged under the stringent National Security Act (NSA).

news_list.description: Barge P305 which sank during Cyclone Tauktae fury six days ago was located on the seabed on Saturday, the Navy said, while it continued the search for 20 missing personnel from two vessels.

news_list.description: The government of West Bengal today reported first case of death due to mucormycosis, commonly known as Black Fungus infection,

news_list.headline: BJP Targets Kamal Nath For

news_list.description: A man who was going to buy medicines was slapped by a district official and thrashed by policemen amid the COVID-19 lockdown in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur. Visuals of the incident were shared widely on social media.

news_list.description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday hit out at Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the government's handling of the novel coronavirus pandemic amid India's fight against Covid.

news_list.description: Maharashtra on Saturday reported 26,133 fresh COVID-19 cases and 682 deaths, taking the tally to 55,53,225 and the death count to 87,300, the state health department said.

news_list.headline: Assam To Bring Cow Protection Bill In Next Assembly Session: Governor
news_list.description: The Assam government plans to bring in a law to protect cows by banning transport of cattle outside the state, among other measures.

news_list.headline: 15-Year-Old Boy Affected By Black Fungus After Covid Recovery In Gujarat
news_list.description: A 15-year-old-boy in Ahmedabad in Gujarat has been detected with Mucormycosis or Black Fungus a week after he recovered from COVID-19, a doctor treating him said today.

news_list.description: The Delhi High Court on Saturday observed that unpreparedness of the health infrastructure in the national capital had compelled many desperate citizens of Delhi to seek admission and medical attention at hospitals in the neighboring states.

news_list.headline: Coronavirus Curfew Extended Till May 31 In UP
news_list.description: The partial coronavirus curfew in Uttar Pradesh has been extended till 7 am on May 31, a state government statement said on Saturday.

news_list.headline: Ramdev Draws Doctors' Fury, Legal Trouble Over "Allopathy Is Stupid" Video
news_list.description: Yoga guru Ramdev, the face of one of India's biggest consumer goods and alternative medicine empires, has been asked to apologise by the Indian Medical Association for ostensibly saying more people died of modern medical treatments during Covid.

news_list.headline: Family Of Delhi Doctor Who Died Of Covid Given Rs 1 Crore
news_list.description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday provided financial assistance of Rs one crore to the family of late "Corona warrior" Dr Anas Mujahid.

news_list.description: Coronavirus vaccination centres run by Mumbai's civic body will be shut today, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) announced on Saturday adding that the details for Monday will be shared by them on Twitter on Sunday.

news_list.description: The WHO is yet to reach a consensus on the vaccine passport issue for allowing international travel to those fully vaccinated against the coronavirus infection, the government said on Saturday and noted that discussions are still on.

news_list.description: Two doses from either the Oxford/AstraZeneca or the Pfizer vaccine are over 80 per cent effective in preventing infection from the B1.617.2 variant of COVID-19, first discovered in India, a new UK government study has reportedly found.

news_list.description: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan today said that the coronavirus-induced restrictions in the state would be gradually relaxed from the next month.

news_list.headline: Door-To-Door Vaccination In Villages Along Line Of Control In J&K

news_list.description: The Centre is now focused on ensuring that children do not become part of the chain spreading COVID-19, NITI Ayog member - Health, Dr VK Paul said today.

news_list.description: Twenty-six Jharkhand migrant workers stuck in Nepal due to COVID-induced lockdown there on Saturday reached India-Nepal border and boarded a bus for their home in Dumka, a top official said.

news_list.headline: BJP Leader Seeks Culpable Homicide Case Against Company In Barge Tragedy
news_list.description: Maharashtra BJP leader Ashish Shelar on Saturday demanded that Afcons Infrastructure whose chartered barge P305 sank off the Mumbai coast on May 17, leaving 60 onboard personnel dead so far, be charged with culpable homicide.

news_list.headline: Lioness, Blackbucks Drowned In Gujarat, But Not Due To Cyclone Tauktae, Says Official: Report
news_list.description: A lioness and four blackbucks were found dead near a dam at Visavadar in Gir forest division of Gujarat's Junagadh district, an official said today.

news_list.headline: 2 Arrested For Duping Woman Of Over Rs 5 Lakh On Matrimonial Site: Delhi Police
news_list.description: Two men have been arrested for allegedly duping women after promising to marry them, the police said today.

news_list.headline: "US Stands With People Of India" In Fight Against Covid: Envoy
news_list.description: The United States stands with the people of Delhi and India in the fight against COVID-19, said US envoy Daniel B Smith today.

news_list.headline: "Can't Live Without
news_list.description: Former TMC MLA Sonali Guha, who switched over to the BJP ahead of the elections, on Saturday wrote to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, apologising to her for leaving the party and urging her to take her back.

news_list.headline: Delhi Reports 3.5% Covid Positivity, Lowest Cases Since March 31
news_list.description: Delhi's positivity rate has dropped to 3.58 per cent, lowest since April 1, as the more contagious and dangerous wave of the coronavirus infections continued to recede.

news_list.headline: "Prove It!": Navjot Sidhu Furious As Amarinder Singh Hints He May Join AAP
news_list.description: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who has been critical of Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh over the desecration issue, today challenged him to prove that he had met any leader of other party for switching sides.

news_list.headline: Salman Rushdie's Tweet After Being Mistaken For Salman Khurshid
news_list.description: It all started with senior Congress leader Salman Khurshid describing former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi and his son Rahul Gandhi as the "once" and "future king" of democracy.

news_list.headline: Over 8 Lakh Migrants Left Delhi In 4 Weeks Of Lockdown Amid 2nd Covid Wave: Report
news_list.description: Over eight lakh migrant workers left the national capital in the first four weeks of the lockdown imposed to contain the spread of the second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to a report from the Delhi Transport Department.

news_list.headline: Tamil Nadu Extends Lockdown For A Week, Announces Stricter Curbs
news_list.description: Shops will remain open today and tomorrow till 9 pm to help public stock up on things.

news_list.headline: Cyclone Yaas May Intensify Into "Very Severe Cyclonic Storm", Cross Odisha, Bengal: Report
news_list.description: A low-pressure area formed over east-central Bay of Bengal, which is likely to intensify into a very severe cyclonic storm and move towards Bengal, adjoining north Odisha and Bangladesh coasts around May 26 morning, the regional met department said.

news_list.headline: Jharkhand Slams Centre For Objection To Supreme Court Intervention On Covid
news_list.description: The Jharkhand government hailed the Supreme Court for its timely intervention, saying it led to optimal distribution and utilisation of oxygen and other essential drugs amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

news_list.headline: Over 8,800 Affected By Black Fungus, 23,000 Vials Sent To States: Minister
news_list.description: Nearly 9,000 people have been infected with mucormycosis or Black Fungus across the country, Union Minister Sadananda Gowda said today. In view of the rapid surge, the government has sent over 20,000 vials of a key drug used for its treatment.

news_list.headline: Arvind Kejriwal Has 4 Suggestions For PM Modi To Increase Vaccination
news_list.description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal today gave four suggestions to the central government to increase the vaccine supply.

news_list.headline: "Take Immediate Action": Sonia Gandhi To PM On Black Fungus Drug Shortage
news_list.description: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi in a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi cited the acute shortage of vital drug - Amphotericin-B - needed to treat Black Fungus, and underscored the need to "take immediate action" to remedy the situation.

news_list.headline: Over 1.6 Crore COVID-19 Vaccine Doses Still Available With States: Centre
news_list.description: More than 1.6 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with states and union territories, and over 2.67 lakh doses will be supplied to them in the next three day, the Union health ministry said today.

news_list.headline: "In A Helicopter For A Photo Session": Uddhav Thackeray's Jibe At PM Modi Over Cyclone Tauktae
news_list.description: Amid BJP's criticism over the duration of his visit to cyclone-hit Konkan region of Maharashtra, Uddhav Thackeray hit back, saying that he was at least taking stock of the situation on the ground and not conducting an aerial survey in a helicopter.

news_list.headline: Bengal BJP Leader Suvendu Adhikari's Father, Brother Get Y+ Security
news_list.description: The Centre today further fueled the politics of confrontation in West Bengal, extending security cover to father and brother of Suvendu Adhikari, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's arch rival.

news_list.headline: 420 Doctors, Including 100 In Delhi, Died In 2nd Covid Wave: Medical Body
news_list.description: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) has said 420 doctors, including 100 in Delhi, have succumbed to the coronavirus infection in the crippling second wave of the pandemic that has overwhelmed the hospitals and has kept the crematoriums blazing.

news_list.headline: Oxygen Express Piloted By All Women Crew Brings 120 Tonne Oxygen To Bengaluru
news_list.description: An Oxygen Express train piloted by an "All Female Crew" arrived in Bengaluru with 120 metric tonnes of medical oxygen from Jamshedpur, the Railways said today.

news_list.headline: "Why Is Uttarakhand Getting Step-Child" Treatment" Amid Covid: High Court To Centre
news_list.description: The Uttarakhand High Court has rapped the Centre for not paying heed to the medical needs of people in remote areas of the state amid the raging second wave of COVID-19, saying it is treating the hill state like a "step-child".

news_list.headline: Uttarakhand Government Issues SOPs To Prevent Black Marketing Of Black Fungus Medicine
news_list.description: The Uttarakhand government has issued Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to prevent the black marketing of Black Fungus medicine keeping in view cases of the disease being reported across the country.

news_list.headline: Goa Government Pegs Losses Due To Cyclone Tauktae At Rs 146 Crore
news_list.description: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Friday said the state suffered losses to the tune of Rs 146 crore due to cyclone Tauktae.

news_list.headline: ONGC Employee Released A Month After Kidnapping In Assam
news_list.description: Assam insurgent group United Liberation Front of Asom - Independent (ULFA-I) today released Ritul Saikia, an ONGC employee it had kidnapped last month.

news_list.headline: COVID-19 Crisis In India A Warning For Other Middle-Income Nations: IMF
news_list.description: Observing that the ongoing "catastrophic" 2nd wave of COVID-19 in India is a sign that the worst may be yet to come, the IMF said the situation in India is a warning of the possible events in low-and middle-income nations.

news_list.headline: CBI Gives Clean Chit To Lalu Yadav In DLF Bribery Case: Sources
news_list.description: The CBI has given a clean chit in a bribery case to former railway minister and Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Lalu Yadav, who is out on bail since April after spending more than three years in jail, sources have said.

news_list.headline: Delivered 13,319 Tonnes Of Liquid Medical Oxygen To States So Far: Railways
news_list.description: The Railways has so far delivered 13,319 tonnes of liquid medical oxygen (LMO) in more than 814 tankers to states across the country since it started operating the Oxygen Express service last month.

news_list.headline: 2.57 Lakh New Covid Cases In India, Highest Testing In A Day: 10 Points
news_list.description: India recorded 2.57 lakh fresh Covid cases and 4,194 deaths in the last 24 hours. The country saw a new record with 20,66,285 samples tested since yesterday. The overall case count surged past the 2.62 crore-mark this morning.

news_list.headline: India, Pfizer Seek To Bridge Dispute Over Vaccine Indemnity: Report
news_list.description: Pfizer and the Indian government are seeking to resolve tensions over a demand by the US drugmaker for legal protection from any claims linked to the use of its COVID-19 vaccine in one of the world's biggest markets, two sources told Reuters.

news_list.headline: Coronavirus India Updates: 2.57 Lakh New Covid Cases In India; Over 8,800 Affected By Black Fungus, Says Minister
news_list.description: India on Saturday recorded new cases of coronavirus infection at over 2.57 lakh, taking the total tally of COVID-19 cases to 2,62 crore according to the Union Health Ministry data.

news_list.headline: Delhi Goverment Think-Tank Gets Over 2,300 Oxygen Concentrators Through Donations
news_list.description: The Dialogue and Development Commission got donations for over 2,300 oxygen concentrators.

news_list.headline: Supreme Court To Hear Plea To Prevent Alleged Exodus Of People Due To Bengal Violence
news_list.description: Supreme Court agreed to hear a plea seeking directions to the Centre and West Bengal government to prevent alleged exodus of people due to "state-sponsored" violence and forming an SIT to investigate and take appropriate action against culprits.

news_list.headline: Chargesheet Against Actor Deep Sidhu, Others In Republic Day Violence Case
news_list.description: Nearly four months after the violence at Red Fort on the Republic Day, Delhi Police has filed a voluminous chargesheet against actor-activist Deep Sidhu and 15 others in connection with the case.

news_list.headline: Remove "Indian Variant" References, Centre To Social Media Firms: Report
news_list.description: The information technology (IT) ministry has written to all social media companies asking them to take down any content that refers to an "Indian variant" of the coronavirus, according to a letter issued on Friday which was seen by Reuters.

news_list.headline: Army Chief Reviews Situation Along Northern Border In Arunachal Pradesh
news_list.description: Army Chief Gen MM Naravane reviewed India's operational readiness along the boundary with China in the Arunachal Pradesh sector during a two-day visit to the Northeastern region that began on Thursday.

news_list.headline: Navy Decommissions INS Rajput After 41 Years Of Service
news_list.description: The Indian Navy's Kashin-class destroyer INS Rajput, the first warship to be fitted with long-range BrahMos missile, was decommissioned on Friday after 41 years of service.

news_list.headline: After NDTV Report, Assam LPG Delivery Staff Designated Frontline Workers
news_list.description: Two days after NDTV carried a report of LPG distributors asking the Assam government to vaccinate cooking gas delivery staff by recognising them as frontline workers, the state government has said it will soon start inoculating them.

news_list.headline: Tripura Reports Its First Case Of Black Fungus Infection In Covid Patient
news_list.description: Tripura reported its first case of Mucormycosis or Black Fungus in a COVID-19 patient, two days after the infection was declared an epidemic by the centre.

news_list.headline: "Lack Of Medical Facility": P Chidambaram On Declining Cases, Rising Deaths
news_list.description: The daily Covid-19 death figure remains above 4,000 despite a declining case positivity, indicating a lack of medical care, Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram said Friday, inviting a prompt reply from Health Minister Harsh Vardhan

news_list.headline: 188 Rescued, 60 Bodies Recovered After Barge Sinks Off Mumbai Coast
news_list.description: At least 188, including two from the anchor boat Varaprada, have been rescued so far from the barge P305, which sank after Cyclone Tauktae hit the Arabian Sea off the coast of Mumbai on May 17, the Defence Public Relations Officer (PRO) said Friday.

news_list.headline: Covid Hospital Discharges Outnumber Admissions For 1st Time In Nearly 2 Months
news_list.description: For the first time in nearly two months, the number of people discharged from hospitals on a daily basis after recovering from COVID has outnumbered the number of those getting admitted, official data shows.
