news_list.description: The National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) has begun positioning its teams in West Bengal and Odisha as Cyclone Yaas is likely to hit these states on the eastern coast of the country around May 26-27, officials said on Friday.

news_list.headline: Uttar Pradesh To Declare Black Fungus Notifiable Disease
news_list.description: The Uttar Pradesh government will declare black fungus a notifiable disease under the Epidemic Diseases Act.

news_list.headline: 45 Lakh Affected In Massive Air India Data Breach Including Credit Cards
news_list.description: Ten years' worth of customer data including credit cards, passports and phone numbers has been leaked in a massive breach at Air India, the airline has announced.

news_list.headline: After Narada Order That Divided Judges, Larger High Court Bench Announced
news_list.description: A larger bench of the Calcutta High Court will take up the case involving the arrests in the Narada bribery case on Monday after all four Bengal politicians - including two ministers - were sent to house arrest after two judges of the division bench

news_list.headline: 'There's No 5G Testing, Towers Don't Spread Covid': States Battle Rumour
news_list.description: A rumour that 5G testing in India has led to a spike in Covid cases and deaths has fueled fears in villages of Haryana, Punjab, and UP. The government is battle the paranoia.

news_list.headline: Arvind Kejriwal, US envoy Discuss Ways To Address Pandemic
news_list.description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and US envoy Daniel B Smith on Friday discussed the ways in which Delhi and America can work together to address the COVID pandemic.

news_list.headline: Chhattisgarh Sends Rs 1,500 Crore To 22 Lakh Farmers For Monsoon Sowing
news_list.description: The Chhattisgarh government has spent Rs 1,500 crore in paying 22 lakh farmers directly into their bank accounts as input cost subsidy so that they can prepare to sow kharif or monsoon crop.

news_list.headline: Over 300 Black Fungus Cases In Pune, Short On Treatment Drug: Ajit Pawar
news_list.description: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar on Friday said over 300 cases of Mucormycosis, a fungal infection prevalent among people who have recovered from COVID-19, have been reported in Pune district.

news_list.headline: Israel President Praises "Generosity, Kind-Heartedness" of Indian Caregiver Killed In Hamas Rocket Attack
news_list.description: Israeli President Reuven Rivlin has praised the "generosity and kind-heartedness" of an Indian caregiver who was killed on May 11 in a rocket attack by Palestinian terrorists from Gaza.

news_list.headline: 13 Maoists Including 7 Women Killed In Maharashtra's Gadchiroli Encounter
news_list.description: Thirteen Maoists including seven women were killed in an encounter with police in the Etapalli forest area in Gadchiroli district of Maharashtra on Friday.

news_list.headline: "Would Rather Die": Jailed Activist Stan Swamy On Mumbai Hospital Treatment
news_list.description: Jesuit priest Stan Swamy told the Bombay High Court on Friday that his health has deteriorated steadily since his arrest, but he would rather "suffer and possibly die" than getting treatment at a state-run hospital in Mumbai.

news_list.headline: Watch: Heavy Rain In Odisha As East Coast Braces For Cyclone Yaas
news_list.description: Several parts of Odisha received heavy rain today even as the state government laid down guidelines for coastal districts in view of the forecast on the formation of cyclonic storm Yaas.

news_list.headline: Karnataka Extends Lockdown Till June 7, Daily Cases Above 32,000
news_list.description: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa on Friday further extended the statewide lockdown till June 7 to fight the surge in Covid cases.

news_list.headline: "Resume Farm Law Talks": Farmers' Body Tells PM Modi
news_list.description: Several rounds of talks between farmers and the government representatives have failed to break the deadlock over the three Central pieces of legislation.

news_list.headline: "Unconstitutional": Court On IGST On Imported Oxygen Concentrators For Personal Use
news_list.description: The Delhi High Court Friday held as "unconstitutional", the imposition of Integrated Goods and Services Tax (IGST) by the Centre on import of oxygen concentrators by individuals for personal use.

news_list.headline: Minister Meets Family Of Kerala Woman Killed In Hamas Strike
news_list.description: Union Minister V Muraleedharan on Friday visited the residence of Soumya Santhosh, who was killed in a Palestinian rocket attack in Israel, and assured the Centre's support to the needs of her nine-year-old son.

news_list.headline: 5.8 Magnitude Earthquake Near Changlang In Arunachal Pradesh
news_list.description: An earthquake of magnitude 5.8 was reported near Changlang in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday evening, according to India's National Center for Seismology.

news_list.headline: Focused On "Fake Praises": Akhilesh Yadav Targets PM Modi, Yogi Adityanath
news_list.description: Attacking Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav said lives of people could have been saved had both focused on arranging essentials for Covid patients instead of indulg

news_list.headline: 120-Year-Old Kashmir Woman Takes Covid Jab; Honoured By Army Commander
news_list.description: A 120-year-old woman has become an inspiration for people living in rural areas of Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district after she took a lead in her remote hamlet to get vaccinated against COVID-19.

news_list.headline: High Courts Must Avoid Passing Impossible Covid Orders: Supreme Court
news_list.description: The Supreme Court on Friday asked the various High Courts to avoid passing orders impossible to implement when it comes to Covid-related matters.

news_list.headline: Uddhav Thackeray Making Political Remarks Over Cyclone: Devendra Fadnavis
news_list.description: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray was making "political comments" while touring areas of the state hit by cyclone Tauktae and advised the latter that "this is not the time to indulge in politics"

news_list.headline: Rs 35-75 Lakh Compensation For Families Of Those Killed In Barge Tragedy
news_list.description: Afcons Infrastructure, whose chartered barge P305 with 261 personnel at the Bombay High offshore oilfield was wrecked by Cyclone Tauktae earlier this week, on Friday announced compensation to families who lost their loved ones in the incident.

news_list.headline: "Ensure Medical Supplies Stocks": Centre To States Bracing For Cyclone Yaas
news_list.description: The Centre has asked Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal and Andaman and Nicobar Islands to ensure that health facilities are stocked with essential medicines and supplies to meet any exigencies in the wake of Cyclone Yaas.

news_list.headline: In Madhya Pradesh, 4 Die Of Black Fungus, Injection Shortage Reported
news_list.description: Four people from Damoh and Balaghat districts in Madhya Pradesh have died of Mucormycosis even as the state grapples with a shortage of injections for its treatment, officials said.

news_list.headline: What Is Black Fungus And Why Are Cases Up In India: What We Know So Far
news_list.description: Several thousand coronavirus patients in India have contracted a deadly and aggressive fungal infection, compounding the country's troubles as it reels from the pandemic.

news_list.headline: India Vaccine Export Ban Hurts Developing Nations, Says IMF
news_list.description: Unveiling a proposal on how a $50 billion investment plan can vaccinate people around the world against COVID-19 by the middle of next year, the IMF on Friday said India's decision to ban the export of vaccines was affecting developing countries.

news_list.headline: $9 Trillion Benefit, Normalcy Sooner: IMF Plan To Vaccinate All By Mid-2022
news_list.description: About $50 billion may be all it takes to vaccinate all eligible people around the world by the middle of next year, the International Monetary Fund or IMF has said, proposing an investment programme.

news_list.headline: Strengthen Facilities For Children Orphaned By COVID-19: Centre To States
news_list.description: The Union home ministry has asked states and union territories to strengthen facilities for vulnerable groups, especially children, who have been orphaned in the second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic in order to check human trafficking, a government s

news_list.headline: Have To Reserve Beds For PM, President, Says Court On Plea For Transparency
news_list.description: The Delhi High Court Friday said beds have to reserved in hospitals for treatment of certain categories of people like the President and Prime Minister of the country.

news_list.headline: Tarun Tejpal Acquittal May Deter Other Assault Victims, Say Activists
news_list.description: Women rights activists have said the decision to acquit journalist Tarun Tejpal in a sexual assault case will deter other victims from coming forward to report crimes against them, saying once again a survivor was "demeaned and humiliated".

news_list.headline: Centre Asks Twitter To Drop "Manipulated" Tag For Toolkit Tweets: Sources
news_list.description: The government has asked Twitter to remove "manipulated media" tag for tweets on an alleged "Congress toolkit" to discredit COVID-19 efforts, calling it "prejudicial, a clear overreach and unwarranted", sources said today.

news_list.headline: Will Seek Centre's Aid For Infra To Reduce Cyclone Impact: Uddhav Thackeray
news_list.description: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said his government will seek Central assistance to set up permanent infrastructure along the sea coast to minimize the damage caused by cyclones.

news_list.headline: US Defended Amazon After Article Showed It Bypassed Indian Law: Report
news_list.description: US officials rushed to defend Amazon's business practices in India after reports that the company had favored certain sellers on its website and bypassed local law.

news_list.headline: MK Stalin Seeks Release Of Rajiv Gandhi Case Convicts; No, Says Congress
news_list.description: The Tamil Nadu Congress Committee on Friday said it does not agree with Chief Minister MK Stalin demanding the centre to set free the seven Rajiv Gandhi assassination case life convicts and denounced what it called ''political pressure".

news_list.headline: Rebel Andhra MP Gets Bail, Supreme Court Says May Have Been Ill-Treated
news_list.description: Rebel YSR Congress MP K Raghurama Krishnam Raju, arrested on sedition charges last week, was granted bail by the Supreme Court today. The court observed that he may have been ill-treated in police custody.

news_list.headline: A Temple For 'Corona Devi' In Tamil Nadu
news_list.description: A 'Corona Devi' temple has come up on the outskirts of Coimbatore in Tamil Nadu. An idol, named 'Corona Devi' made of black stone has also been placed in the temple.

news_list.headline: DRDO Develops Antibody Test Kit DIPCOVAN For Early Covid Detection
news_list.description: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has developed an antibody test kit for the early screening of COVID-19.

news_list.headline: Centre Explores Possibility Of Covaxin Production Outside India: Report
news_list.description: To address the shortage of COVID-19 jabs in the country, the government is exploring the possibility of boosting production of vaccines, including identifying manufacturing sites for indigenously developed Covaxin outside India, sources said.

news_list.headline: Shashi Tharoor's Reply After KTR Suspects His Role In Naming Covid Drugs
news_list.description: Most social media platforms are swarming with names of drugs used to treat COVID-19 infection as India continues to battle the second wave of the pandemic.

news_list.headline: Southwest Monsoon Arrives Over Andaman And Nicobar Islands: Met Office
news_list.description: Monsoon 2021: The Southwest Monsoon has arrived over the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, the India Meteorological Department said on Friday.

news_list.headline: Goa Government To Move High Court Against Tarun Tejpal's Acquittal: Chief Minister
news_list.description: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Friday said the state government will challenge in the high court journalist Tarun Tejpal's acquittal in a 2013 rape case by a district court in state capital Panaji.

news_list.headline: "Matter Of Great Concern": Sachin Pilot On Rajasthan MLA's Resignation
news_list.description: Congress leader and former deputy chief minister Sachin Pilot on Friday said senior legislator Hemaram Chaudhary's resignation is a matter of concern.

news_list.headline: 5 More Manufactures Given License To Produce Black Fungus Treatment Drug: Government
news_list.description: The Union Health Ministry on Friday said license has been given to five more manufactures for production of Amphotericin-B, used in the treatment of black fungus, and they will start producing 1,11,000 vials of the drug per month from July.

news_list.headline: Centre To Ramp Up Production, Availability Of Anti-Black Fungus Medicine
news_list.description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Friday said the Central government will make proactive efforts for significantly ramping up domestic production of Amphotericin-B drug, an anti-fungal drug for the treatment of Black Fungus disease.

news_list.headline: India, Pfizer At Impasse Over Vaccine Indemnity Demand: Report
news_list.description: Pfizer and New Delhi are at loggerheads over a demand by the US drugmaker for legal protection from any claims linked to the use of its COVID-19 vaccine in one of the world's biggest markets, two sources told Reuters.

news_list.headline: "Centre Involved In Anti-People Activities, Exploiting Farmers": Sonia Gandhi
news_list.description: Congress president Sonia Gandhi on Friday accused the BJP-led government at the Centre of indulging in anti-people activities, playing with the future of farmers and acting against their interests by bringing new agriculture laws.

news_list.headline: Doorstep Treatment Will Reduce Burden On Health System: PM Modi
news_list.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that bringing treatment to the doorsteps of patients will reduce the burden on the health system and he also provided a new mantra in COVID management - 'Jaha bimar, wahi upchaar'.

news_list.headline: Covid Patients Ran Out After Oxygen Leak Chaos At Bengal Hospital: Report
news_list.description: Oxygen leakage at the North Bengal Medical College and Hospital in Siliguri was a cause of concern among COVID-19 patients and their families this morning, officials said.

news_list.headline: Delhi's Covid Positivity Rate Falls Below 5%, Lowest Since April 4
news_list.description: Coronavirus: Delhi's COVID-19 positivity rate has fallen below 5 per cent in the past 24 hours, which is the lowest since April 4.

news_list.headline: UK Cases Of India-Dominant Variant More Than Double In Week
news_list.description: The number of U.K. cases of a worrying India-dominant coronavirus variant more than doubled for a second week as authorities also monitor a new mutation of the virus, adding fresh doubt to U.K. plans to fully unlock the economy.

news_list.headline: International Tea Day 2021: 10 Interesting Things To Know About Tea
news_list.description: International Tea Day 2021: All over the world, International Tea Day is being celebrated today. Did you know tea is the second most popular drink after water? Find out few interesting facts about tea

news_list.headline: Video: Gang Waves Gun At Birthday 'Party', Mocks Madhya Pradesh Lockdown
news_list.description: A gang of young men in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district turned a birthday party into a show of strength, waving guns and mocking the coronavirus lockdown.q

news_list.headline: Mamata Banerjee Set To Contest From Earlier Seat After Losing Nandigram
news_list.description: Mamata Banerjee, who swept the Bengal election but lost her own contest in Nandigram, is set to return to the seat she gave up in favour of challenging her former aide Suvendu Adhikari in his stronghold.

news_list.headline: "Insult To Assam People": Activist Akhil Gogoi 'Manhandled' Before Oath
news_list.description: Jailed RTI activist Akhil Gogoi, who was elected from Assam's Sibsagar seat in the recently held state polls, was allegedly manhandled at the Assembly by government personnel before he was sworn in as an MLA today.

news_list.headline: Tarun Tejpal, Acquitted Of Rape, Recounts "7.5 Years Of Trauma For Family"
news_list.description: Journalist Tarun Tejpal, who was acquitted of rape charges in a 2013 case by court in Goa today, said the last seven-and-a-half years had been traumatic for his family as they dealt with the catastrophic fallout of the false allegations against him.

news_list.headline: Foreign Minister S Jaishankar To Begin 5-Day US Visit From Monday: Centre
news_list.description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will begin a five-day visit to the United States from Monday with a focus on procurement of COVID-19 vaccines from American companies as well as explore the possibility of their joint production.

news_list.headline: Sunderlal Bahuguna, Noted Environmentalist, Dies Of COVID-19
news_list.description: Sunderlal Bahuguna, one of India's best-known environmentalist and a pioneer of the Chipko Movement against the cutting of trees, today died of COVID-19 in Rishikesh.

news_list.headline: Cyclone Tauktae: 51 Dead, 24 Missing From Sunken Barge P305, Navy Continues Search
news_list.description: The number of deaths on barge P305 that sank in the Arabian Sea five days ago rose to 51 on Friday with the recovery of two more bodies even as the Navy and the Coast Guard continued the search for the 24 personnel missing from the barge

news_list.headline: PM Chokes Up As He Pays Tribute: "This Virus Took Away Many Loved Ones"
news_list.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was visibly emotional today as he spoke about those who had lost their lives to Covid.

news_list.headline: On Rajiv Gandhi's Death Anniversay, Congress Leader Tweets Throwback Pics
news_list.description: Today marks the 30th death anniversary of former prime minister Rajiv Gandhi and social media tributes have been pouring in from all quarters for the leader.

news_list.headline: BJP's Sambit Patra's 'Toolkit' Post Marked "Manipulated Media" By Twitter
news_list.description: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra's tweet alleging a "Congress toolkit" to discredit the government and Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Covid handling has been marked as "manipulated media" by Twitter.

news_list.headline: Anti Terrorism Day 2021: Homage To Heroes Who Died Fighting Terrorists
news_list.description: Anti Terrorism Day 2021: India observes Anti Terrorism Day to spread the message of peace and humanity. Anti Terrorism Day is marked on the death anniversary of Rajiv Gandhi

news_list.headline: "Black Fungus A New Challenge, We Must Be Prepared," Says PM
news_list.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today warned against what he called the "new challenge of Black Fungus" and said the country must be prepared to fight the rare and potentially fatal condition that is increasingly seen in recovering Covid patients.
